233        RAL9023(0x828282, "Pearl dark grey");
234        
235        private final int r, g, b;
236        private final String name;
237
238        RalColor(int r, int g, int b) {
239                this.r = r;
240                this.g = g;
241                this.b = b;
242                this.name = null;
243        }
244        
245        RalColor(int rgb, String name) {
246                Color c = new Color(rgb);
247                this.r = c.getRed();
248                this.g = c.getGreen();
249                this.b = c.getBlue();
250                this.name = name;
251        }
252
253        public int getRed() {
254                return r;
255        }
256
257        public int getGreen() {
258                return g;
259        }
260
261        public int getBlue() {
262                return b;
263        }
264
265        public Color getColor() {
266                return new Color(r, g, b);
267        }
268
269        public int getRGB() {
270                return getColor().getRGB();
271        }
272
273        public String getRGBString() {
274                /*
275                 * toHexString will return "0" instead of "00" String.format will not
276                 * 0-pad Strings or Hex Have to do it manually...
277                 */
278                return String.format("#%s%s%s",
279                                (r < 0x10 ? "0" : "") + Integer.toHexString(r), (g < 0x10 ? "0"
280                                                : "") + Integer.toHexString(g), (b < 0x10 ? "0" : "")
281                                                + Integer.toHexString(b));
282        }
283                
284        public String getName() {
285                return this.name;
286        }
287
288        public static Color[] getColors(RalColor... wcols) {
289                Color[] rgbColors = new Color[wcols.length];
290                for (int i = 0; i < wcols.length; i++) {
291                        rgbColors[i] = wcols[i].getColor();
292                }
293                return rgbColors;
294        }
295        
296        public static final Color[] PreferredColors =
297                        getColors(
298                                        RAL1004, 
299                                        RAL1026, 
300                                        RAL3020, 
301                                        RAL4006, 
302                                        RAL5002, 
303                                        RAL6037,
304                                        RAL8004
305                                        );
306}
